business.headline: Personal loan rates 2025: How much are SBI, ICICI and others charging?Many banks in India have updated their personal loan interest rates for 2025. Most banks are offering rates starting from about 9.50% per year and going up to 10.50% for some customers, depending on their credit score and repayment ability.

TCS benching policy sparks fear among employees after first cycle: ReportThe policy, introduced on June 12, limits the time employees can remain without project work to just 35 days. After this, they face the risk of losing out on promotions or even losing their jobs.

New UPI rules: What happens if payments fail now?Earlier, if someone raised a chargeback, say, when money was deducted, but they did not get what they paid for, and it got declined, the bank had to go through an extra step.

Parliament panel proposes revival of key tax relief for companies: ReportThe government is set to restore Section 80M in the new Income Tax Bill, easing dividend tax burdens for companies. The bill is likely to pass in the Monsoon Session.

Are e-commerce firms hiding your rating? New survey reveals the truthThe survey asked consumers about their experience when posting negative reviews on e-commerce and quick commerce apps. Out of 16,519 responses, only 11% said their negative reviews were "published as is."
Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,200; SBI shares up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 41.02 points to 82,593.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.30 points to 25,198.75 as of 9:30 am.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces to list today. Will it make strong market debut?The company had set a price band of Rs 407 per share for the IPO. The total issue size was Rs 582.56 crore, which included a fresh issue of 1.09 crore shares worth Rs 445 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 34 lakh shares valued at Rs 137.56 crore.

Anthem Biosciences IPO: Allotment status live. GMP, listing details hereInvestors who applied for the Anthem Biosciences IPO can check their allotment status online through two platforms: the BSE website and the website of the IPO registrar, KFin Technologies.
Sensex closes 64 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 63.57 points to end at 82.634.48, while the NSE Nifty50 gained just 16.25 points to close at 25,212.05.

Gurugram's luxury flats, flooded streets: Is real estate bubble about to burst?Gurugram's luxury real estate may be booming, but repeated rain-induced flooding is testing its long-term value. If basic infrastructure fails, even the city's glitziest addresses could lose their appeal.

Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

entertainment.headline: Aasif Khan shares photo from hospital bed, reads Rahat Indori's Main Zinda Hoon'Panchayat' actor Aasif Khan, who recently suffered a heart attack, is now recovering in hospital. He shared a photo reading Rahat Indori's book 'Main Zinda Hoon'.

Salman Khan roots for devi Sonakshi Sinha ahead of Nikita Roy, urges fans to watchSonakshi Sinha is making a grand return to the big screen with her supernatural thriller 'Nikita Roy', releasing on July 18. Salman Khan has expressed his excitement for the film, which promises a gripping story of an investigator challenging supernatural myths.

Barkha Bisht confirms joining Smriti Irani in Kyunki reboot, here's what she playsThe popular TV show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' is set to return, with Smriti Irani and Amar Upadhyay reprising their roles. Actor Barkha Bisht has also confirmed her inclusion in the cast.

Anupam Kher opens up on losing child with Kirron Kher, and life with SikandarAnupam Kher opens up about not having biological children with wife Kirron Kher, his bond with stepson Sikander, and how his career shaped personal choices. The veteran actor also opened up on Kirron's pregnancy, which didn't work due to complications.

Allu Arjun and family enjoy visit to Universal Studios in US, actor shares picsAllu Arjun, along with his wife, Sneha, and children, Ayaan and Arha, visited Universal Studios in the US. The actor and his wife shared pictures from their visit.

My baby, my vagina: Richa Chadha on criticism over natural birth remarkActor Richa Chadha celebrated her daughter Zuneyra's first birthday with a heartfelt post. She also firmly addressed the social media criticism over her natural birth remark.

Comedian Pete Davidson, girlfriend Elsie Hewitt announce pregnancyComedian Pete Davidson and girlfriend Elsie Hewitt are expecting their first child, confirmed by an Instagram post on July 16. The couple, who began dating earlier this year, shared the news with an ultrasound image.

Unforgivable: Rupali Ganguly slams Bangladesh for demolishing Satyajit Ray's homeRupali Ganguly strongly condemned the demolition of Satyajit Ray's ancestral home in Bangladesh, calling it 'disgusting and unforgivable'. The incident has sparked widespread anger across India and among Bengalis around the world.

Siddhant Chaturvedi hints at Gully Boy 2-Dhadak 2 crossover with Ishaan KhatterSiddhant Chaturvedi recently hinted at a surprising Bollywood crossover, suggesting a role reversal between him and Ishaan Khatter in Gully Boy 2 and Dhadak 2. He made a playful remark, saying "Dhadak 2 x Gully Boy 2," while mimicking Akshay Kumar's iconic swapping gesture from 'Ajnabee'.

10 Years of Bajrangi Bhaijaan: Director Kabir Khan shares BTS photos from setsDirector Kabir Khan marked 10 years of Bajrangi Bhaijaan by sharing memories and behind-the-scenes photos from the film's shoot. Fans flooded the post with requests to release the sequel soon.

Exclusive: Salman Khan recalls building his own bike, doing stunts for Bobby DeolSalman Khan opened up about his passion for bikes and performing stunts, sharing a rare story of building a bike from scratch. He emphasised the urgent need for better motorsport infrastructure in India to support aspiring riders.

Tomorrowland organisers issue statement after massive fire destroys main stageA massive fire broke out on the main stage of the Tomorrowland Festival in Belgium just two days before the event, causing severe damage. The organisers shared a statement on social media, stating that no harm occurred during the incident.

Nick Jonas shares romantic beach video with Priyanka Chopra, fans say well done jijuNick Jonas shared a romantic beach video with Priyanka Chopra that's winning hearts on the internet. Their cute chemistry and Nick's 'jiju' vibes have made Indian fans fall in love all with them over again.

Actor Vishal appeals to stop filming public reviews inside theatres for initial showsActor Vishal, at a recent event, sought a temporary ban on public review recordings in theatres to preserve film integrity. He urged the media and exhibitors to co-operate, stressing on giving a breathing space for films to perform.

Vishnu Manchu's Kannappa screened at Rashtrapati Bhavan, actor calls it honourTelugu film 'Kannappa', starring Vishnu Manchu, was screened at Rashtrapati Bhavan, attracting praise for its emotional and visual impact. This marks a significant achievement for Telugu cinema, highlighting its cultural and cinematic depth.

Salman Khan on prepping for Galwan: It's slow, not feeling it yet | ExclusiveSalman Khan is undergoing intense physical and mental preparation for his upcoming film, 'Battle of Galwan'. In an exclusive interview with India Today, the actor opened up about his prep for the role.

Supergirl first look: Milly Alcock stars in DC's gritty new filmJames Gunn unveiled the first poster for Supergirl starring Milly Alcock. The film, set for 2026, explores a darker, grittier origin story, expanding DC Studios' rebooted universe with fresh emotional depth.

Disney sues Hong Kong jewellery firm over Mickey Mouse trademarkDisney has sued Hong Kong's Red Earth Group, accusing it of trademark infringement for using Mickey Mouse imagery in its jewellery line. The entertainment giant seeks a court injunction and damages.

Harry Potter stars Emma Watson, Zoe Wanamaker banned from driving for speedingEmma Watson and Zoe Wanamaker, both Harry Potter stars, have been banned from driving for six months and fined £1,044 each after separate speeding offences and prior penalty points.

general news.headline: Servants of RCB: Karnataka argues against revoking cop's suspension over stampedeOfficers acted as servants of RCB: Karnataka argues against revoking Bengaluru cop's suspension over stampede

Pilots object amid US crash report putting focus on Air India captain's 'role'A report in The Wall Street Journal, citing cockpit recordings, claimed the captain of the Air India jet cut the fuel flow to the engines. The government has urged the public to refrain from jumping to conclusions.

Exclusive: Demolished house not Satyajit Ray's, says Bangladesh officialA house demolished in Bangladesh's Mymensingh was wrongly linked to Satyajit Ray's ancestors, Dhaka official confirmed, claiming that the iconic filmmaker's ancestral home, Durlov House, remained untouched.

Praggnanandhaa stuns Magnus Carlsen with 39 moves in Freestyle Chess tournamentTeenage Indian Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa continued his strong form in 2025 with a statement victory over world number one Magnus Carlsen at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas.

It was touch and go, Obama quips as Michelle and he shut down divorce rumoursBarack and Michelle Obama, joined by Michelle's brother Craig Robinson, addressed divorce rumours for the first time with humour and sincerity, reaffirming their strong relationship.

Karnataka blames RCB for stampede, cites Virat Kohli's video appealIn its report to the High Court, the Karnataka government has blamed Royal Challengers Bengaluru for the fatal stampede on June 4, pointing to Virat Kohli's public video appeal which it said drew an overwhelming crowd.
How India went the 'extra' mile in Lord's Test defeatThe margin of loss against England wasn't really 22 runs, but the 63 extras that Team India conceded in the match

Indore bags cleanest city title for 8th year, Noida tops in 3-10 lakh categoryIndore retained its cleanest city title for the eighth year in a row, with President Murmu conferring the Swachh Survekshan Awards that recognised urban bodies for innovation, sanitation and citizen participation.

Meet Animesh Kujur: India's fastest man, breaking one barrier at a timeAt just 22, Animesh Kujur is now India's fastest man yet. Hailing from a remote village in Chhattisgarh, he is rewriting the history of Indian track and field.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Andhra Pradesh man kills 22-year old live-in partner for refusing prostitutionA 22-year-old woman was fatally stabbed by her live-in partner in Andhra Pradesh's Ambedkar Konaseema district after she refused to engage in prostitution. Her mother and brother were also injured.

9-year-old dies after suffering multiple heart attacks during school lunch breakA nine-year-old girl, a class 4 student at Adarsh Vidya Mandir in Sikar, died after suffering consecutive heart attacks within hours.

After sugar boards, CBSE pushes oil boards to cut fat intake in schoolsTo tackle the growing obesity crisis amongst schoolchildren, CBSE has launched a new initiative called 'Oil Boards'. These informative displays are designed to educate students about the dangers of consuming excessive unhealthy fats and promote healthier eating habits on campus.

10-year-old Tamil Nadu girl abducted, sexually assaulted while on way back homeA ten-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted in broad daylight in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur district while she was walking back home. The accused is said to have covered her mouth and forcibly abducted her.

Raj Thackeray party workers force man to apologise over anti-Marathi statusA shopkeeper was forced to apologise by MNS workers after he posted a social media status containing objectionable language about Marathi and Maharashtra.
Early puberty is for real: How to help our childrenThe average age for first menstruation in India has dropped to around 12 years, and some girls are showing signs of puberty as early as age seven

Exclusive: Salman Khan recalls building his own bike, doing stunts for Bobby DeolSalman Khan opened up about his passion for bikes and performing stunts, sharing a rare story of building a bike from scratch. He emphasised the urgent need for better motorsport infrastructure in India to support aspiring riders.

Nitish Kumar's Bihar poll power play: Free electricity for up to 125 unitsBihar free electricity: The move, coming months ahead of the crucial Bihar Assembly elections, is expected to benefit 1.67 crore families in the state.
IIT Madras launches India's lightest active wheelchairThe breakthrough from IIT Madras combines cutting-edge engineering with inclusive design to redefine personal mobility in India.

Imran Khan's call from jail: Hold Asim Munir liable if anything happens to meIn a lengthy post on X, Imran Khan, who has been languishing in jail for the past two years along with his wife, said they were being deprived of basic human rights.

Man performs Bhangra on London Underground escalator as commuters record videoWhile some commuters looked on or recorded the scene, others continued on their way as the man danced down the escalator with a portable speaker playing the popular Punjabi track Mundian Tu Bach Ke Rahi.

50 people killed in massive fire at hypermarket in Iraq's KutAt least 50 people were killed in a massive fire at a hypermarket in Iraq's al-Kut city, according to the state-run Iraqi News Agency (INA). The exact cause of the fire remains unclear yet.

10 accidents reported in 3 hours at same spot on Pune road after temporary repairNo fatalities were reported in the accidents but several two-wheeler riders sustained injuries after slipping on a muddy patch, as captured by CCTV cameras.

Declared dead in womb by hospital, woman delivers healthy baby at private clinicThe woman in Madhya Pradesh's Satna was told her baby was stillborn by a government hospital but delivered a healthy boy hours later after a private scan revealed the foetus was alive.

Aasif Khan shares photo from hospital bed, reads Rahat Indori's Main Zinda Hoon'Panchayat' actor Aasif Khan, who recently suffered a heart attack, is now recovering in hospital. He shared a photo reading Rahat Indori's book 'Main Zinda Hoon'.

Salman Khan roots for devi Sonakshi Sinha ahead of Nikita Roy, urges fans to watchSonakshi Sinha is making a grand return to the big screen with her supernatural thriller 'Nikita Roy', releasing on July 18. Salman Khan has expressed his excitement for the film, which promises a gripping story of an investigator challenging supernatural myths.

Anupam Kher opens up on losing child with Kirron Kher, and life with SikandarAnupam Kher opens up about not having biological children with wife Kirron Kher, his bond with stepson Sikander, and how his career shaped personal choices. The veteran actor also opened up on Kirron's pregnancy, which didn't work due to complications.

Allu Arjun and family enjoy visit to Universal Studios in US, actor shares picsAllu Arjun, along with his wife, Sneha, and children, Ayaan and Arha, visited Universal Studios in the US. The actor and his wife shared pictures from their visit.

sports.headline: Japan Open 2025: Lakshya Sen, Satwik-Chirag eliminated in Round of 16 clashIndia's charge in the Japan Open is all but over as top stars like Lakshya Sen and the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty were eliminated from the tournament after losing their respective Round of 16 matches.

Gautam Gambhir will have to alter India's Jasprit Bumrah plan: David LloydFormer England cricketer David Lloyd feels India head coach Gautam Gambhir will have to alter their plans regarding Jasprit Bumrah to make a comeback in the ongoing series against England.

Ashwin recalls his father's bold prediction about Siraj in thrilling Lord's TestEngland vs India: Former Indian cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin shared an amusing anecdote, revealing that his father was confident Mohammed Siraj would finish the match by hitting three sixes.

Australia coach backs opener Sam Konstas after tough West Indies tourCricket Australia head coach Andrew McDonald has admitted the West Indies series has been "a difficult time" for Sam Konstas but rejected suggestions that the teenager has been damaged by the brutal experience.

Sabalenka withdraws from National Bank Open, opts for extra rest before US OpenWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka has pulled out of the upcoming National Bank Open in Montreal, opting to take additional rest as she prepares to defend her US Open title later this summer.

KL Rahul will outscore Shubman Gill in coming matches: Former England batterFormer England batter Owais Shah has backed KL Rahul to outscore Shubman Gill in the coming matches. Both Rahul and Gill have been in marvellous form in the ongoing series, having plundered runs in the first three matches.

Clive Lloyd urges complete overhaul of West Indies cricket after historic collapseClive Lloyd, the legendary former West Indies captain, has called for a serious and thorough review of cricket at all levels in the Caribbean. His remarks come in the wake of the West Indies Test team's shocking collapse against Australia, where they were dismissed for just 27 runs at Sabina Park.

Praggnanandhaa stuns Magnus Carlsen with 39 moves in Freestyle Chess tournamentTeenage Indian Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa continued his strong form in 2025 with a statement victory over world number one Magnus Carlsen at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas.

Brian Lara slams West Indies Cricket Board for Nicholas Pooran's early retirementLegendary batter Brian Lara has slammed the West Indies Cricket Board for the retirement of Nicholas Pooran, blaming them for not doing anything to keep players loyal.

Jude Bellingham undergoes surgery on dislocated shoulder injuryReal Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham has successfully undergone surgery to correct a long-standing shoulder dislocation issue, the Spanish club announced on Wednesday.

Lamine Yamal inherits Lionel Messi's iconic Barcelona number 10 jerseyYoung Barcelona star Lamine Yamal inherited the club's iconic number 10 shirt-previously worn by all-time great Lionel Messi-on Wednesday. "Our 10," wrote Barça on social media, alongside a video featuring the teenager.

Clive Lloyd urges complete overhaul of West Indies cricket after historic collapseClive Lloyd, the legendary former West Indies captain, has called for a serious and thorough review of cricket at all levels in the Caribbean. His remarks come in the wake of the West Indies Test team's shocking collapse against Australia, where they were dismissed for just 27 runs at Sabina Park.

Praggnanandhaa stuns Magnus Carlsen with 39 moves in Freestyle Chess tournamentTeenage Indian Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa continued his strong form in 2025 with a statement victory over world number one Magnus Carlsen at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas.

Brian Lara slams West Indies Cricket Board for Nicholas Pooran's early retirementLegendary batter Brian Lara has slammed the West Indies Cricket Board for the retirement of Nicholas Pooran, blaming them for not doing anything to keep players loyal.

Jude Bellingham undergoes surgery on dislocated shoulder injuryReal Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham has successfully undergone surgery to correct a long-standing shoulder dislocation issue, the Spanish club announced on Wednesday.

Lamine Yamal inherits Lionel Messi's iconic Barcelona number 10 jerseyYoung Barcelona star Lamine Yamal inherited the club's iconic number 10 shirt-previously worn by all-time great Lionel Messi-on Wednesday. "Our 10," wrote Barça on social media, alongside a video featuring the teenager.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
